review.title: Diversified Top-k Partial MaxSAT Solving
review.abstract: We introduce a diversified top-k partial MaxSAT problem, a combination of partial MaxSAT problem and enumeration problem. Given a partial MaxSAT formula F and a positive integer k, the diversified top-k partial MaxSAT is to find k maximal solutions for F such that the k maximal solutions satisfy the maximum number of soft clauses of F. This problem can be widely used in many applications including community detection, sensor place, motif discovery, and combinatorial testing. We prove the problem is NP-hard and propose an approach for solving the problem. The concrete idea of the approach is to design an encoding EE which reduces diversified top-k partial MaxSAT problem into partial MaxSAT problem, and then solve the resulting problem with state-of-art solvers. In addition, we present an algorithm MEMKC exactly solving the diversified top-k partial MaxSAT. Through several experiments we show that our approach can be successfully applied to the interesting problem.

metadata.title: Diversified Top-k Partial MaxSAT Solving

sections.heading: 2 Preliminaries
sections.text: In this section, we will first present some definitions related to this paper.A letter is either a Boolean variable (short: variable) x or its negation ¬ x. A positive letter is only a variable x, and the negative letter is the negation of a variable, i.e., ¬ x. A clause is a combination of letters. The length of a clause is the number of letters that contain the clause. A clause is a unity clause if the length of the clause is 1. A formula F in conjunctive normal form (CNF) is a conjunction of clauses. The length of a formula F expressed by | F | is the number of clauses contained in the formula. Any variable in F can assume a true or false value. An assignment of truth to F is a map that assigns a value to each variable.

sections.heading: 6 Experimental Results
sections.text: In this section, we conduct experiments to evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of EE coding by comparing our MEMKC algorithm, the diversified top-k clique solver EnumKOpt [12], the diversified top-k CA solver k-CA [20] and the state-of-the-art partial MaxSAT solvers Openwbo [21], Dist [22] and CCLS [23].

sections.heading: 6.1 Experimental Preliminaries
sections.text: We implement the MEMKC algorithm in the C + + programming language. Since the enumeration of all models is mathematically insoluble, MEMKC is only used in Part 1 to evaluate the small instances. EnumKOpt is the best current approximate solver for diversified top k clique. The diversified top k CA solver k-CA, which is implemented in C + +, is an approximate solver by greedily invoking the state-of-the-art CA solver TCA [20]. Dist and CCLS are excellent approximate solvers for partial MaxSAT. The time limits of EnumKOpt, k-CA, Dist and CCLS are set at 1800, 300, 300 seconds if executed once each. Openwbo, an exact solver, wins first prize in unweighted partial MaxSAT tracks in MaxSAT Evaluation 2016. The shut-off time of Openw000 seconds is 30,000 seconds.

sections.heading: 7 Conclusion
sections.text: In this thesis, we define the diversified top-k partial MaxSAT problem, which partially generalizes MaxSAT problem and enumeration problem. We offer an EE encryption algorithm from diversified top-k partial MaxSAT to partial MaxSAT. To verify the accuracy of the EE encryption, we propose an exact MEMKC algorithm. In the experiments, we show that our approach can successfully solve the diversified top-k partial MaxSAT problem and that this problem can be effectively applied to diversified top-k clique and diversified top-k CA problems.

metadata.abstractText: We introduce a diversified top-k partial MaxSAT problem, a combination of partial MaxSAT problem and enumeration problem. Given a partial MaxSAT formula F and a positive integer k, the diversified top-k partial MaxSAT is to find k maximal solutions for F such that the k maximal solutions satisfy the maximum number of soft clauses of F . This problem can be widely used in many applications including community detection, sensor place, motif discovery, and combinatorial testing. We propose an approach for solving the problem. The concrete idea of the approach is to design an encoding EE which reduces diversified top-k partial MaxSAT problem into partial MaxSAT problem, and then solve the resulting problem with state-of-art solvers. In addition, we present an algorithm MEMKC exactly solving the diversified top-k partial MaxSAT. Through several experiments we show that our approach can be successfully applied to the interesting problem.
